content.description: A round spinner is divided into five sections, where the sections do not have the same size. Using the measure of the interior angles, the probability of the spinner landing on any individual space on a spin is calculated and given in the table.
content.question: Section 1 2 3 4 5 Probability 0.40 0.20 0.20 0.15 0.05 A statistics student is asked to test the integrity of the spinner using a chi-square goodness-of-fit test. What is the minimum number of times the spinner should be spun to conduct this test?

topic.text: 8.2: Setting up a Chi-Square Goodness of Fit Test

skill.text: Skill 4.C: Verify that inference procedures apply in a given situation.
